Key Arguments: The scope of companies and content covered by the Bill is too broad, potentially infringing on freedom of expression and privacy.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are overly broad and could lead to over-compliance and restriction of legitimate speech.
The Bill lacks sufficient transparency and oversight mechanisms for the ACMA's powers.
The enforcement measures are too stringent and could lead to over-removal of content.
The Bill could complicate existing voluntary measures and progress made under them.
Notable Quotes: The broad definitions, breadth of services covered, and insufficient transparency and oversight of the ACMAâ€™s proposed responsibilities in the Bill could entail serious risks for privacy and freedom of expression.
Heavy-handed enforcement measures can result in over-compliance by companies and a loss of flexibility that may be needed to address misinformation and disinformation.
